subject: Perl Conference
header: Talking about conference, I would like to share a big announcement about The Perl and Raku Conference 2025. It was a big surprise for me. I hope and wish this time, it would be a big crowd puller for both attendees and sponsors. We even have the action report of TPRC 2024 as shared by TPF. Plenty of interesting results came out of it.

Well, if we are talking conference then how can we miss the long awaiting London Perl & Raku Conference 2024. It is going strong as we are approaching the event. A gentle reminder to myself to get my slides ready for my talk. I am super excited to meet my heroes in person.
Last but not least, you please take care of your health. Enjoy rest of the newsletter.

entries.title: Dates and location have been set for TPRC 2025!
entries.author: ruth_bavousett
entries.text: For all Perl and Raku fans, the venue for TPRC 2025 is declared finally.

entries.title: TPRC 2024 after action report
entries.author: amber_krawczyk
entries.text: We now have feedback for TPRC 2024 as shared by TPF.

chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Sajid Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one champion at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month, thanks to the sponsor Lance Wicks.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Strong Password" and "Valid Number". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 287

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Self Spammer" and "Order Game" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 286

entries.author: ali
entries.text: Master of compact and readable Perl code. Incredible, keep it up great work.
entries.title: TWC286

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: Raku magic once again showing the power of one-liner. Thanks for sharing knowledge with us every week.
entries.title: Self Order

entries.author: david_ferrone
entries.text: Do you miss code review? I do a lot. Thanks to the post this week, I got a glimpse of it. Thank you for your efforts.
entries.title: Not Quite a Quine

entries.author: jaldhar_vyas
entries.text: This is for both Perl and Raku fans. You get to see the flavour of both and implementation too. Keep sharing knowledge with us.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 286

entries.author: jorg_sommrey
entries.text: Don't you love the rule breakers? I love them as it make the game more interesting. Hihgly recommended.
entries.title: Randomly Extremal

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Lots of Perl and Raku magic in display this week. Plenty to keep you busy, thanks for your contributions.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 286: Self Spammer

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Over the time, we noticed the translation of Raku into Perl but this week we got the bonus Perl to Raku port. Brilliant, thanks for sharing.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 286: Order Game

entries.author: luis_mochan
entries.text: This week we got more than what we asked. I really enjoyed the variation. Thanks for your contributions.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 286

entries.author: matthias_muth
entries.text: Loved the detailed implementation knowledge, it makes the reading so easy to follow. Great work, keep it up.
entries.title: The Random Spammer Testing Game

entries.author: packy_anderson
entries.text: Blogging is a special skill and here you get to see it yourself. Technical blog can be fun too. Well done.
entries.title: Spammer Game

entries.author: peter_campbell_smith
entries.text: CPAN can be handy when you struggle to find the quick solution. How? Please checkout the post.
entries.title: My word - and min max

entries.author: peter_pentchev
entries.text: Interesting take on interpreted and compiled languages trying to find the program source. Enough to keep you busy, great work.
entries.title: PWC 286

entries.author: robbie_hatley
entries.text: Nice breakdowm of task into easy to understand action. The end result is short and crispy. Cool, keep it up.
entries.title: To The Weekly Challenge #286

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: CPAN can never let you down, if you know what you are looking for. Here we found another gem function that takes all the work load. Highly recommended.
entries.title: The Game of Order

entries.author: tim_king
entries.text: Story telling format is one of my favourite and this is exactly what I like. It is worth checking, you really don't want to skip.
entries.title: Quines are boring, but generative AI still can't do my job

entries.author: torgny_lyon
entries.text: Clever recursive function is not a bad choice, to be honest. I liked the implementation too, keep it up great work.
entries.title: Week 286 - Self Spammer & Order Game

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
